h: 22-yr-old biker killed in Road accident at Bhosari Phata
sub_h: A motorcyclist was killed after a private bus hit his vehicle in an attempt to overtake it on the Punemumbai Highway in Bhosari Phata early Tuesday. The bus driver fled the scene after the accident. The officer from the Bhosari Police said the accident occurred around 430 am. Pawar was riding his motorcycle from Akurdi towards Bhosari. The private bus too was plying on the same route in an attempt to overtake the bus hit the motorcycle Pawar lost control of his vehicle and fell on the road. He had suffered serious injuries in the accident and following this he was taken to a nearby hospital where he succumbed to his injuries during treatment. The bus driver has been identified and the police are searching for him. There have been other s involving private buses in the recent past. Two pedestrians died after they were hit by a private bus at Mali Mala on the Punesolapur Road in Loni Kalbhor around 6am on January 24. The two women had deboarded a bus and were crossing the road when a private bus heading from Latur to Pune hit them. Mon September 22 2022 a privatelyoperated luxury bus knocked down a 60yearold woman pedestrian at Gunjan Chowk on Pune-

h: Teenager killed in Road accident in Maharashtra

h: Maharashtra: Four pilgrims killed in Road accident in Solapur district

h: 182 killed in 461 accidents in Nashik city in 2022
sub_h: In 2022, 182 people died in 461 accidents in Nashik City, India. The main reasons for these deaths were overspeeding and riding without helmets. Police officials said that an analysis of the data revealed that overspeeding was responsible for more than 70 of the fatalities. Additionally, 48 people died due to dangerous driving and 54 bikers had fatal accidents as they were not using helmets. Three others were killed due to wrongside driving and two died when they met with an accident while speaking on their cell phone. There are around 25 accident blackspots across the city. After the horrific accident at the Mirchi Hotel Chowk in October last year, the Nashik Municipal Corporation initiated steps to set up speed calming measures at these blackspots. Police Commissioner Ankush Shinde told TOI, "efforts will be made to bring down the number of s in the city. It is also necessary for people to follow the traffic rules and drive their vehicles cautiously for their own safety and the safety of others on the streets." There is also rising concern about the increasing number of vehicles on city roads every year, and thousands of new vehicles are added to city roads every year. This has led to traffic jams becoming common across the city. The traffic police said

h: Man killed in Road accident in Nashik city

h: Bombay HC enhances payout to kin of accident victim by Rs 1 crore

One of the main reasons for these accidents is that drivers are speeding. The police are also trying to enforce traffic rules more strictly. There have been three accidents in Gangapur, one in Ambad, and one in Bhadrakali so far this year.

h: Fewer accidents, casualties same as last year in Nashik
sub_h: The police in Nashik city reported that there were fewer fatal accidents this year, but the number of casualties was almost the same as last year. 182 people have died in Road accidents in Nashik city this year, compared to 176 in 2021. However, at least 100 are twowheeler riders and as many as 45 pedestrians have died in s this year. The police and other departments concerned will continue to work to provide good driving conditions on the city roads, but the foremost responsibility is of the vehicle driver to ensure that his driving style does not endanger his life or that of others on the road.

h: 10 months, 868 accidents, 253 dead, 953 injured: Nagpur traffic police study

A total of 868 accidents were reported in the 10 months, which included 239 fatal, 363 serious, and 249 minor accidents. These accidents claimed a total of 253 lives and 953 injured.

h: 435 Road accidents killed 131 people between Jan-May

While Mumbai ranked 32nd among cities with 588 road crashes in 2019 against 691 in 2018, Maharashtra was placed sixth among states with an 8.3% drop—27,286 cases in 2019 compared to 29,740 in 2018.

Four killed in separate accidents
Mumbai: Birthday celebration turns into tragedy as one dies in Road accident at Sion highway
sub_h: In a shocking incident a 30-year-old youth who had gone along with friends including his maternal brother to celebrate the latter's birthday at Bhiwandi eatery ended up in a Road accident in which he died while others received minor injuries on the Sion Eastern Express highway early Saturday morning.

h: PM Narendra Modi condoles death of people in Road accident
sub_h: "The accident in Maharashtra's Nashik district is unfortunate. In this hour of sadness, my thoughts are with the bereaved families. May the injured recover at the earliest," the Prime Minister's Office said in a tweet quoting Modi.

h: 8-year-old girl killed in Road accident near Pune
Pune: Driver killed and 4 injured as vehicle rams e-way railings after tyre burst
sub_h: A person died while four others suffered injuries when the car they were travelling by rammed iron railings on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway near Gahunje on Monday afternoon, following a tyre burst.

h: Five people die in seperate Road accidents in rural district
Three of family killed as truck hits scooter in Thane
sub_h: A couple and their four-year-old daughter were killed when a truck hit their scooter in Maharashtra's Thane district on Tuesday morning, police said.

h: Nashik: Teenager killed in hit-and-run accident, friend injured
sub_h: A teenager was killed after his scooter was hit by a motorcycle on the Mahatma Nagar Road, near Jaipur House, in the Parijat Nagar area of the city on Tuesday night.

h: Two killed, 25 injured as MSRTC bus overturns on Pune-Satara road
sub_h: Two people were killed and at least 25 were injured after a state transport bus overturned on Pune- Satara road on Monday afternoon, police said.

h: Nashik: Most Road accident fatalities between midnight & 6 am
sub_h: Vehicled being driven at high speeds at night have been causing the highest number of Road accident-related fatalities in the district, revealed the Nashik Regional Transport Office (RTO) at a workshop organised by it in the city for RTO officials from across five districts in the division.

h: Road accident victim's family gets Rs 12.79 lakh compensation
sub_h: A Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) in Maharashtra's Thane district has awarded over Rs 12 lakh compensation to the family of a man who died in a Road accident in 2015.

h: Kolhapur: Two killed, eight injured in accident
sub_h: Two cousins from Karveer taluka were killed and eight of their relatives injured when their SUV hit a road divider at Kanangala village in Karnataka, 45 km away from Kolhapur, on the Pune-Bangalore National Highway on Tuesday night.

h: Fewer Road accidents in January-February this year than same period in 2018
